direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve modifying the attributes of an element, but clearAttributes removes all attributes while removeAttr removes a specific attribute.
Both methods interact with the attributes of an element, but attr sets a specific attribute while clearAttributes removes all attributes.
Both methods access the attributes of an element, but clearAttributes modifies them while attributes retrieves them.

enhanced_by.reason: attributes() can be used to retrieve the current attributes before clearing them, which can be useful for setting up test cases.
removeAttr can be used to remove specific attributes before calling clearAttributes, which can be useful for testing the method's behavior.
attributes() can be used to verify that all attributes have been cleared after calling clearAttributes.
